text: The Shanti Bahini (, "Peace Force") was the name of the military wing of the Parbatya Chattagram Jana Sanghati Samiti - the United People's Party of the Chittagong Hill Tracts in Bangladesh. It was formed in 1972 to preserve the rights of the tribal people in south-eastern Bangladesh, and fought for many years against the central government. Bangladeshi Insurgents Say India Is Supporting Them - New York Times It abandoned militancy following the peace treaty signed by the government and the Shamiti on December 2, 1997.
